definition: to develop rapidly after abrupt turn (idiom); dramatic change
urgent/pressing/rapid/hurried/worried/to make (sb) anxious
see 轉文|转文[zhuai3 wen2]
to revolve/to turn/to circle about/to walk about/classifier for revolutions (per minute etc): revs, rpm/classifier for repeated actions
to turn/to change direction/to transfer/to forward (mail)
straight/to straighten/fair and reasonable/frank/straightforward/(indicates continuing motion or action)/vertical/vertical downward stroke in Chinese characters
surname Zhi/Zhi (c. 2000 BC), fifth of the legendary Flame Emperors 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action

sentences.english: Tan said since Li took over the magazine's management, its circulation had seen a sharp drop.
sentences.chinese: 谭楷说，自从李昶执掌了杂志之后，发行量急转直下。

sentences.english: The credit crunch last year brought a reversal of fortune.
sentences.chinese: 但去年的信贷危机使得冰岛命运急转直下。

sentences.english: The Heavenly Famous Garden complex shows how quickly the market has run into a wall.
sentences.chinese: 天时名苑楼盘显示了楼市是如何的急转直下。

sentences.english: The stock market turned down sharply.
sentences.chinese: 股票市场行情急转直下。

sentences.english: The military on the front went swiftly ahead.
sentences.chinese: 前方的军事局势急转直下。

definition: to hit rock bottom (idiom)
to steadily deteriorate
lit. to drop a thousand zhang in one fall (idiom)/fig. (of business, popularity etc) to suffer a sudden, devastating decline/to take a dive
troops in defeat like a landslide (idiom); a beaten army in total collapse
the mountain road twists around each new peak (idiom)/(of a mountain road) twisting and turning/fig. an opportunity has come unexpectedly/things have taken a new turn
not expected at the outset (idiom)/unforeseen/to be surprised by the turn of events
imminent danger (idiom); approaching a crisis
utterly defeated/routed/crushed/to collapse (of army)
to fall rapidly/to plummet
unexpected (idiom)/surprising
to change dramatically/radical change
too bad/how terrible/what bad luck/terrible/bad
one stumble, unable to rise (idiom); a setback leading to total collapse/ruined at a stroke/unable to recover after a minor hitch
valley floor/(fig.) lowest ebb/all-time low
Waterloo (Belgium)/Battle of Waterloo (1815)/fig. a defeat/failure
like a hot knife through butter (idiom)/with irresistible force
